017package org.microbean.type;
018
019import java.util.ArrayList;
020import java.util.Collection;
021import java.util.Collections;
022import java.util.HashSet;
023import java.util.List;
024import java.util.Objects;
025
026import java.util.function.Predicate;
027
028import org.microbean.development.annotation.Convenience;
029import org.microbean.development.annotation.EntryPoint;
030import org.microbean.development.annotation.Experimental;
031import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingDiscouraged;
032import org.microbean.development.annotation.OverridingEncouraged;
033
034/**
035 * A value-like object representing a (Java-like) type for purposes of
036 * testing assignability.
037 *
038 * <p>Concisely: {@link Type}s represent {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
039 * java.lang.reflect.Type}s (or other frameworks' similar
040 * representations) without any dependence on {@link
041 * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}.</p>
042 *
043 * <p>This class is used primarily by the {@link Semantics} class and
044 * its subclasses.</p>
045 *
046 * @param <T> the type of the thing representing a Java type that is
047 * being adapted; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type} or some other
048 * framework's representation of one
049 *
050 * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
051 * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
052 *
053 * @see Semantics
054 */
055@Experimental
056public abstract class Type<T> {
057
058
059  /*
060   * Instance fields.
061   */
062
063
064  private final T type;
065
066
067  /*
068   * Constructors.
069   */
070
071
072  /**
073   * Creates a new {@link Type}.
074   *
075   * @param type the type to represent; must not be {@code null}
076   *
077   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code type} is {@code null}
078   */
079  protected Type(final T type) {
080    super();
081    this.type = Objects.requireNonNull(type, "type");
082  }
083
084
085  /*
086   * Instance fields.
087   */
088
089
090  /**
091   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
092   * a Java type that has a name.
093   *
094   * <p>In the Java reflective type system, only {@link Class} and
095   * {@link java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable} instances have names.</p>
096   *
097   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
098   * a Java type that has a name
099   *
100   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
101   * and deterministic.
102   *
103   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
104   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
105   *
106   * @see #name()
107   *
108   * @see Class#getName()
109   *
110   * @see java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable#getName()
111   */
112  @OverridingEncouraged
113  public boolean named() {
114    return this.name() != null;
115  }
116
117  /**
118   * Returns the name of this {@link Type} if it has one <strong>or
119   * {@code null} if it does not</strong>.
120   *
121   * <p>Only classes and type variables in the Java reflective type
122   * system have names.</p>
123   *
124   * @return the name of this {@link Type}, or {@code null}
125   *
126   * @nullability Implementations of this method may, and often will,
127   * return {@code null}.
128   *
129   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
130   * and deterministic.
131   *
132   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
133   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
134   */
135  public abstract String name();
136
137  /**
138   * Returns {@code true} if this {@link Type} represents the same
139   * type as that represented by the supplied {@link Type}.
140   *
141   * <p>Type representation is not the same thing as equality.
142   * Specifically, a {@link Type} may represent another {@link Type}
143   * exactly, but may not be {@linkplain Type#equals(Object) equal to}
144   * it.</p>
145   *
146   * <p>Equality is <em>subordinate</em> to type representation.  That
147   * is, in determining whether a given {@link Type} represents
148   * another {@link Type}, their {@link Type#equals(Object)
149   * equals(Object)} methods may be called, but a {@link Type}'s
150   * {@link Type#equals(Object) equals(Object)} method must not call
151   * {@link #represents(Type)}.</p>
152   *
153   * @param type the {@link Type} to test; may be {@code null} in
154   * which case {@code false} will be returned
155   *
156   * @return {@code true} if this {@link Type} represents the same
157   * type as that represented by the supplied {@link Type}
158   *
159   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
160   * idempotent and deterministic.
161   *
162   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
163   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
164   */
165  @OverridingEncouraged
166  public boolean represents(final Type<?> type) {
167    if (type == this) {
168      return true;
169    } else if (type == null) {
170      return false;
171    } else if (this.equals(type) || Objects.equals(this.object(), type.object())) {
172      return true;
173    } else {
174      return false;
175    }
176  }
177
178  /**
179   * Returns the object supplied at construction time that is the type
180   * this {@link Type} is representing.
181   *
182   * @return the object supplied at construction time that is the type
183   * this {@link Type} is representing
184   *
185   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
186   *
187   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
188   *
189   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
190   * threads.
191   */
192  public final T object() {
193    return this.type;
194  }
195
196  /**
197   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
198   * the uppermost reference type in the type system.
199   *
200   * <p>In all practical cases, if an implementation of this method
201   * returns {@code true}, it means this {@link Type} represents
202   * {@link Object Object.class}.</p>
203   *
204   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
205   * meet these requirements.</p>
206   *
207   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
208   * the uppermost reference type in the type system, e.g. {@link
209   * Object Object.class}
210   *
211   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
212   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
213   *
214   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
215   * and deterministic.
216   */
217  public abstract boolean top();
218
219  /**
220   * If this {@link Type} represents a primitive type, and if and only
221   * if boxing is enabled in the type system being represented,
222   * returns a {@link Type} representing the corresponding "wrapper
223   * type", or this {@link Type} itself in all other cases.
224   *
225   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
226   * meet these requirements.</p>
227   *
228   * @return a {@link Type} representing the corresponding "wrapper
229   * type" where appropriate, or {@code this}
230   *
231   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
232   * {@code null}.
233   *
234   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
235   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
236   *
237   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
238   * and deterministic.
239   */
240  public abstract Type<T> box();
241
242  /**
243   * Returns an {@linkplain
244   * Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection) unmodifiable and
245   * immutable <code>Collection</code>} of the <em>direct
246   * supertypes</em> of this {@link Type}, or an {@linkplain
247   * Collection#isEmpty() empty <code>Collection</code>} if there are
248   * no direct supertypes.
249   *
250   * <p>The direct supertypes of a type are defined to be those which
251   * are described by the <a
252   * href="https://docs.oracle.com/javase/specs/jls/se17/html/jls-4.html#jls-4.10.2"
253   * target="_parent">Java Language Specification, section 4.10.2</a>,
254   * minus any types featuring wildcards.</p>
255   *
256   * <p>These direct supertypes of a reflective Java type may be
257   * acquired if needed via the {@link
258   * JavaTypes#directSupertypes(java.lang.reflect.Type)} method.</p>
259   *
260   * <p>The {@link Collection} returned must not contain {@code this}
261   * and must have no {@code null} or duplicate elements.</p>
262   *
263   * <p>The ordering within the returned {@link Collection} is not
264   * specified, <strong>but must be deterministic between
265   * invocations</strong>.</p>
266   *
267   * <p>The size of the {@link Collection} returned must not change
268   * between calls.</p>
269   *
270   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
271   * meet these requirements.</p>
272   *
273   * @return an {@linkplain
274   * Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection) unmodifiable and
275   * immutable <code>Collection</code>} of the <em>direct
276   * supertypes</em> of this {@link Type}; never {@code null}
277   *
278   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
279   * {@code null}.
280   *
281   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
282   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
283   *
284   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
285   * and deterministic.
286   */
287  public abstract Collection<? extends Type<T>> directSupertypes();
288
289  /**
290   * If this {@link Type} represents a parameterized type or a generic
291   * array type, returns a {@link Type} representing its raw type or
292   * generic component type, or, if this {@link Type} does not
293   * represent a parameterized type or a generic array type, returns
294   * {@code this}.
295   *
296   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
297   * meet these requirements.</p>
298   *
299   * @return a suitable {@link Type}; never {@code null}; often {@code
300   * this}
301   *
302   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
303   * {@code null}.
304   *
305   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
306   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
307   *
308   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
309   * and deterministic.
310   */
311  public abstract Type<T> type();
312
313  /**
314   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
315   * a generic class by virtue of having type parameters.
316   *
317   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #typeParameters()} method
318   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
319   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
320   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
321   *
322   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
323   * a generic class by virtue of having type parameters
324   *
325   * @see #typeParameters()
326   */
327  @OverridingEncouraged
328  public boolean hasTypeParameters() {
329    return !this.typeParameters().isEmpty();
330  }
331
332  /**
333   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
334   * a parameterized type by virtue of having type arguments.
335   *
336   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #typeArguments()} method
337   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
338   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
339   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
340   *
341   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
342   * a parameterized type by virtue of having type arguments
343   *
344   * @see #typeArguments()
345   */
346  @OverridingEncouraged
347  public boolean hasTypeArguments() {
348    return !this.typeArguments().isEmpty();
349  }
350
351  /**
352   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
353   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
354   * parameters.
355   *
356   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
357   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a generic
358   * class.</p>
359   *
360   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
361   * meet these requirements.</p>
362   *
363   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
364   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
365   * parameters; never {@code null}
366   *
367   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
368   * {@code null}.
369   *
370   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
371   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
372   *
373   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
374   * and deterministic.
375   */
376  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> typeParameters();
377
378  /**
379   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
380   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
381   * arguments.
382   *
383   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
384   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
385   * parameterized type.</p>
386   *
387   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
388   * meet these requirements.</p>
389   *
390   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
391   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s type
392   * parameters; never {@code null}
393   *
394   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
395   * {@code null}.
396   *
397   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
398   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
399   *
400   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
401   * and deterministic.
402   */
403  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> typeArguments();
404
405  /**
406   * Returns the <em>component type</em> of this {@link Type}, if
407   * there is one, <strong>or {@code null} if there is not</strong>.
408   *
409   * <p>Implementations of this method must return a non-{@code null}
410   * result only when this {@link Type} represents a type that is
411   * either an array or a generic array type.</p>
412   *
413   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
414   * meet these requirements.</p>
415   *
416   * @return the <em>component type</em> of this {@link Type}, if
417   * there is one, or {@code null} if there is not
418   *
419   * @nullability Implementations of this method may return {@code
420   * null}.
421   *
422   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
423   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
424   *
425   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
426   * and deterministic.
427   */
428  public abstract Type<T> componentType();
429
430  /**
431   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
432   * either a type variable or a wildcard type.
433   *
434   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #upperBounds()} method
435   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
436   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
437   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
438   *
439   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an override does not
440   * meet these requirements.</p>
441   *
442   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
443   * either a type variable or a wildcard type
444   *
445   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
446   * idempotent and deterministic.
447   *
448   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
449   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
450   *
451   * @see #upperBounds()
452   */
453  @OverridingEncouraged
454  public boolean upperBounded() {
455    return !this.upperBounds().isEmpty();
456  }
457
458  /**
459   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
460   * a wildcard type with a lower bound.
461   *
462   * <p>This implementation calls the {@link #lowerBounds()} method
463   * and returns {@code true} if the resulting {@link List}
464   * {@linkplain List#isEmpty() is not empty}.  Subclasses are
465   * encouraged to provide a faster implementation.</p>
466   *
467   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an override does not
468   * meet these requirements.</p>
469   *
470   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} represents
471   * a wildcard type with lower bounds
472   *
473   * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
474   * idempotent and deterministic.
475   *
476   * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe for
477   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
478   *
479   * @see #lowerBounds()
480   */
481  @OverridingEncouraged
482  public boolean lowerBounded() {
483    return !this.lowerBounds().isEmpty();
484  }
485
486  /**
487   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
488   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s lower
489   * bounds.
490   *
491   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
492   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
493   * lower-bounded wildcard type.</p>
494   *
495   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
496   * meet these requirements.</p>
497   *
498   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
499   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s lower
500   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
501   * empty}
502   *
503   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
504   * {@code null}.
505   *
506   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
507   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
508   *
509   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
510   * and deterministic.
511   */
512  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> lowerBounds();
513
514  /**
515   * Returns an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
516   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s upper
517   * bounds.
518   *
519   * <p>The returned {@link List} will be {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
520   * non-empty} if and only if this {@link Type} models either a type
521   * variable, an unbounded wildcard type, or an upper-bounded
522   * wildcard type.
523   *
524   * <p>Undefined behavior will result if an implementation does not
525   * meet these requirements.</p>
526   *
527   * @return an {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableList(List)
528   * unmodifiable <code>List</code>} of this {@link Type}'s upper
529   * bounds; never {@code null}; often {@linkplain List#isEmpty()
530   * empty}
531   *
532   * @nullability Implementations of this method must not return
533   * {@code null}.
534   *
535   * @threadsafety Implementations of this method must be safe for
536   * concurrent use by multiple threads.
537   *
538   * @idempotency Implementations of this method must be idempotent
539   * and deterministic.
540   */
541  public abstract List<? extends Type<T>> upperBounds();
542
543  /**
544   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
545   * class.
546   *
547   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
548   * #named()} returns {@code true} and {@link #upperBounded()}
549   * returns {@code false}.</p>
550   *
551   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
552   * class
553   *
554   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
555   *
556   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
557   * threads.
558   *
559   * @see #named()
560   *
561   * @see #upperBounded()
562   */
563  public final boolean isClass() {
564    return this.named() && !this.upperBounded();
565  }
566
567  /**
568   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
569   * generic array type.
570   *
571   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
572   * #componentType()} returns a non-{@code value} and {@link #type()}
573   * returns a {@link Type} that is not {@code this}.</p>
574   *
575   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
576   * generic array type
577   *
578   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
579   *
580   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
581   * threads.
582   *
583   * @see #componentType()
584   *
585   * @see #type()
586   */
587  public final boolean genericArrayType() {
588    return this.componentType() != null && this.type() != this;
589  }
590
591  /**
592   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
593   * parameterized type.
594   *
595   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
596   * #hasTypeArguments()} returns {@code true}.</p>
597   *
598   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
599   * parameterized type
600   *
601   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
602   *
603   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
604   * threads.
605   *
606   * @see #hasTypeArguments()
607   */
608  public final boolean parameterizedType() {
609    return this.hasTypeArguments();
610  }
611
612  /**
613   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
614   * type variable.
615   *
616   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
617   * #named()} returns {@code true} and {@link #upperBounded()}
618   * returns {@code true}.</p>
619   *
620   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
621   * type variable
622   *
623   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
624   *
625   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
626   * threads.
627   *
628   * @see #named()
629   *
630   * @see #upperBounded()
631   */
632  public final boolean typeVariable() {
633    return this.named() && this.upperBounded();
634  }
635
636  /**
637   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
638   * wildcard type.
639   *
640   * <p>This method returns {@code true} if and only if {@link
641   * #named()} returns {@code true} and one of {@link #upperBounded()}
642   * or {@link #lowerBounded()} returns {@code true}.</p>
643   *
644   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} models a
645   * wildcard type
646   *
647   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
648   *
649   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
650   * threads.
651   *
652   * @see #named()
653   *
654   * @see #upperBounded()
655   *
656   * @see #lowerBounded()
657   */
658  public final boolean wildcard() {
659    return !this.named() && (this.upperBounded() || this.lowerBounded());
660  }
661
662  /**
663   * Returns all the supertypes of this {@link Type} (which includes
664   * this {@link Type}).
665   *
666   * <p>This method reflexively and transitively applies the direct
667   * supertype relation (represented by the {@link
668   * #directSupertypes()} method) to this {@link Type} and returns an
669   * {@linkplain Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection)
670   * unmodifiable <code>Collection</code>} containing the result.</p>
671   *
672   * @return an {@linkplain
673   * Collections#unmodifiableCollection(Collection) unmodifiable
674   * <code>Collection</code>} containing all the supertypes of this
675   * {@link Type} (which includes this {@link Type}); never {@code
676   * null}
677   *
678   * @nullability This method never returns {@code null}.
679   *
680   * @idempotency This method is idempotent and deterministic.
681   *
682   * @threadsafety This method is safe for concurrent use by multiple
683   * threads.
684   *
685   * @see #directSupertypes()
686   */
687  public final Collection<? extends Type<T>> supertypes() {
688    return this.supertypes(this, null);
689  }
690
691  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
692  private final <X> Collection<? extends Type<X>> supertypes(final Type<X> type, Predicate<? super Type<?>> unseen) {
693    if (unseen == null || unseen.test(type)) {
694      final Collection<? extends Type<X>> directSupertypes = type.directSupertypes();
695      if (directSupertypes.isEmpty()) {
696        return List.of(type); // the supertype relation is reflexive as well as transitive
697      } else {
698        if (unseen == null) {
699          unseen = new HashSet<>(8)::add;
700        }
701        final Collection<Type<X>> supertypes = new ArrayList<>(3 * directSupertypes.size() + 1);
702        supertypes.add(type); // the supertype relation is reflexive as well as transitive
703        for (final Type<X> directSupertype : directSupertypes) {
704          for (final Type<X> supertype : this.supertypes(directSupertype, unseen)) {
705            supertypes.add(supertype);
706          }
707        }
708        return Collections.unmodifiableCollection(supertypes);
709      }
710    } else {
711      return List.of();
712    }
713  }
714
715  /**
716   * Returns {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} is a
717   * supertype of the supplied {@link Type}.
718   *
719   * <p>This method uses a combination of the {@link #supertypes()}
720   * method and the {@link #represents(Type)} method in its
721   * implementation.</p>
722   *
723   * @param <X> the type represented by the supplied {@link Type}
724   *
725   * @param sub the purported subtype; must not be {@code null}
726   *
727   * @return {@code true} if and only if this {@link Type} is a
728   * supertype of the supplied {@link Type}
729   *
730   * @exception NullPointerException if {@code sub} is {@code null}
731   *
732   * @see #supertypes()
733   *
734   * @see #represents(Type)
735   */
736  public final <X> boolean supertype(final Type<X> sub) {
737    final Type<T> me = this.box();
738    // Does this represent a supertype of sub?  Remember that the supertype relation is reflexive.
739    for (final Type<?> supertype : this.supertypes(sub.box(), null)) {
740      if (supertype.represents(me)) {
741        return true;
742      }
743    }
744    return false;
745  }
746
747  /**
748   * An abstract embodiment of {@link Type} {@linkplain
749   * #assignable(Type, Type) assignability rules}.
750   *
751   * <p>By default, no {@link Type} {@linkplain #assignable(Type,
752   * Type) is assignable} to any other {@link Type} except itself.
753   * Subclasses will obviously want to override this behavior in some,
754   * if not all, cases.</p>
755   *
756   * @author <a href="https://about.me/lairdnelson"
757   * target="_parent">Laird Nelson</a>
758   *
759   * @see VariantSemantics
760   *
761   * @see InvariantSemantics
762   *
763   * @see CovariantSemantics
764   *
765   * @see CdiSemantics
766   */
767  @Experimental
768  public static abstract class Semantics {
769
770
771    /*
772     * Constructors.
773     */
774
775
776    /**
777     * Creates a new {@link Semantics}.
778     */
779    protected Semantics() {
780      super();
781    }
782
783
784    /*
785     * Instance methods.
786     */
787
788
789    /**
790     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
791     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
792     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
793     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
794     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using no autoboxing.
795     *
796     * <p>This is a convenience method that {@linkplain
797     * JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean) creates
798     * <code>JavaType</code>s} to represent the supplied {@link
799     * java.lang.reflect.Type}s before calling the (canonical) {@link
800     * #assignable(Type, Type)} method.</p>
801     *
802     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
803     * not be {@code null}
804     *
805     * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
806     * not be {@code null}
807     *
808     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
809     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
810     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
811     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
812     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using no autoboxing;
813     * {@code false} otherwise
814     *
815     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
816     * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
817     *
818     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
819     * idempotent and deterministic.
820     *
821     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
822     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
823     *
824     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
825     *
826     * @see JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean)
827     */
828    @Convenience
829    public boolean assignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
830                              final java.lang.reflect.Type payloadType) {
831      return this.assignable(receiverType, payloadType, false);
832    }
833
834    /**
835     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
836     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
837     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
838     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
839     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using the specified
840     * autoboxing semantics.
841     *
842     * <p>This is a convenience method that {@linkplain
843     * JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean) creates
844     * <code>JavaType</code>s} to represent the supplied {@link
845     * java.lang.reflect.Type}s before calling the (canonical) {@link
846     * #assignable(Type, Type)} method.</p>
847     *
848     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
849     * not be {@code null}
850     *
851     * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
852     * not be {@code null}
853     *
854     * @param box whether autoboxing is enabled
855     *
856     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
857     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
858     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
859     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
860     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and using the specified
861     * autoboxing semantics; {@code false} otherwise
862     *
863     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
864     * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
865     *
866     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
867     * idempotent and deterministic.
868     *
869     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
870     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
871     *
872     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
873     *
874     * @see JavaType#of(java.lang.reflect.Type, boolean)
875     */
876    @Convenience
877    public boolean assignable(final java.lang.reflect.Type receiverType,
878                              final java.lang.reflect.Type payloadType,
879                              final boolean box) {
880      return this.assignable(JavaType.of(receiverType, box), JavaType.of(payloadType, box));
881    }
882
883    /**
884     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
885     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
886     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
887     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
888     * this {@link Semantics} instance.
889     *
890     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
891     * receiverType}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
892     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
893     *
894     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadType};
895     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
896     *
897     * @param receiverType the receiver type as described above; must
898     * not be {@code null}
899     *
900     * @param payloadType the payload type as described above; must
901     * not be {@code null}
902     *
903     * @return {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
904     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadType} is assignable
905     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
906     * receiverType}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
907     * this {@link Semantics} instance; {@code false} otherwise
908     *
909     * @exception NullPointerException if either {@code receiverType}
910     * or {@code payloadType} is {@code null}
911     *
912     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
913     * idempotent and deterministic.
914     *
915     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
916     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
917     */
918    @EntryPoint
919    @OverridingDiscouraged
920    public <X, Y> boolean assignable(final Type<X> receiverType, final Type<Y> payloadType) {
921      if (receiverType == Objects.requireNonNull(payloadType, "payloadType") || receiverType.represents(payloadType)) {
922        return true;
923      } else if (receiverType.hasTypeArguments()) {
924        return parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromType(receiverType, payloadType);
925      } else if (payloadType.hasTypeArguments()) {
926        return this.nonParameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
927      } else if (receiverType.componentType() == null) {
928        if (receiverType.lowerBounded()) {
929          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, true, payloadType);
930        } else if (receiverType.upperBounded()) {
931          if (receiverType.named()) {
932            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
933          } else {
934            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, false, payloadType);
935          }
936        } else {
937          return this.classIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
938        }
939      } else if (receiverType.type() == receiverType) {
940        return this.classIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
941      } else {
942        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(receiverType, payloadType);
943      }
944    }
945
946    private final <X, Y> boolean nonParameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverNonParameterizedType,
947                                                                                       final Type<Y> payloadParameterizedType) {
948      if (receiverNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
949        if (receiverNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
950          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, true /* lower bounded */, payloadParameterizedType);
951        } else if (receiverNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
952          if (receiverNonParameterizedType.named()) {
953            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
954          } else {
955            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, false /* upper bounded */, payloadParameterizedType);
956          }
957        } else {
958          return this.classIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
959        }
960      } else if (receiverNonParameterizedType.type() == receiverNonParameterizedType) {
961        return this.classIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
962      } else {
963        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverNonParameterizedType, payloadParameterizedType);
964      }
965    }
966
967    private final <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverClass,
968                                                                           final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
969      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
970        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
971          return this.classIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
972        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
973          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
974            return this.classIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
975          } else {
976            return this.classIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
977          }
978        } else {
979          return this.classIsAssignableFromClass(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
980        }
981      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
982        return this.classIsAssignableFromClass(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
983      } else {
984        return this.classIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverClass, payloadNonParameterizedType);
985      }
986    }
987
988    /**
989     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
990     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadClass} is assignable
991     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
992     * receiverClass}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
993     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and only if {@code
994     * payloadClass} models a {@linkplain Class Java class} and not
995     * any other type, and if and only if {@code receiverClass} models
996     * a {@linkplain Class Java class} and not any other type.
997     *
998     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
999     * method.</p>
1000     *
1001     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1002     *
1003     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1004     * receiverClass}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1005     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1006     *
1007     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadClass};
1008     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1009     *
1010     * @param receiverClass the receiver type as described above; must
1011     * not be {@code null}
1012     *
1013     * @param payloadClass the payload type as described above; must
1014     * not be {@code null}
1015     *
1016     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1017     *
1018     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1019     * idempotent and deterministic.
1020     *
1021     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1022     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1023     *
1024     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1025     */
1026    @OverridingEncouraged
1027    protected <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromClass(final Type<X> receiverClass, final Type<Y> payloadClass) {
1028      return false;
1029    }
1030
1031    /**
1032     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1033     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadClass} is assignable
1034     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1035     * receiverClass}, according to the assignability rules modeled by
1036     * this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and only if {@code
1037     * payloadParameterizedType} models a Java {@linkplain
1038     * java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType parameterized type} and not
1039     * any other type, and if and only if {@code receiverClass} models
1040     * a {@linkplain Class Java class} and not any other type.
1041     *
1042     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1043     * method.</p>
1044     *
1045     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1046     *
1047     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1048     * receiverClass}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1049     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1050     *
1051     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1052     * payloadParameterizedType}; often a {@link
1053     * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1054     *
1055     * @param receiverClass the receiver type as described above; must
1056     * not be {@code null}
1057     *
1058     * @param payloadParameterizedType the payload type as described above; must
1059     * not be {@code null}
1060     *
1061     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1062     *
1063     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1064     * idempotent and deterministic.
1065     *
1066     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1067     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1068     *
1069     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1070     */
1071    @OverridingEncouraged
1072    protected <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverClass, final Type<Y> payloadParameterizedType) {
1073      return false;
1074    }
1075
1076    /**
1077     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1078     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadGenericArrayType} is
1079     * assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the
1080     * supplied {@code receiverClass}, according to the assignability
1081     * rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and
1082     * only if {@code payloadGenericArrayType} models a Java
1083     * {@linkplain java.lang.reflect.GenericArrayType generic array
1084     * type} and not any other type, and if and only if {@code
1085     * receiverClass} models a {@linkplain Class Java class} and not
1086     * any other type.
1087     *
1088     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1089     * method.</p>
1090     *
1091     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1092     *

1094     * receiverClass}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type

1096     *

1098     * payloadGenericArrayType}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1099     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1100     *
1101     * @param receiverClass the receiver type as described above; must
1102     * not be {@code null}
1103     *
1104     * @param payloadGenericArrayType the payload type as described
1105     * above; must not be {@code null}
1106     *
1107     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1108     *
1109     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1110     * idempotent and deterministic.
1111     *
1112     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1113     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1114     *
1115     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1116     */
1117    @OverridingEncouraged
1118    protected <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(final Type<X> receiverClass, final Type<Y> payloadGenericArrayType) {
1119      return false;
1120    }
1121
1122    /**
1123     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1124     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadTypeVariable} is
1125     * assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the
1126     * supplied {@code receiverClass}, according to the assignability
1127     * rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and
1128     * only if {@code payloadTypeVariable} models a Java {@linkplain
1129     * java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable type variable} and not any other
1130     * type, and if and only if {@code receiverClass} models a
1131     * {@linkplain Class Java class} and not any other type.
1132     *
1133     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1134     * method.</p>
1135     *
1136     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1137     *

1139     * receiverClass}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1140     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1141     *
1142     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadTypeVariable};
1143     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1144     *
1145     * @param receiverClass the receiver type as described above; must
1146     * not be {@code null}
1147     *
1148     * @param payloadTypeVariable the payload type as described above; must
1149     * not be {@code null}
1150     *
1151     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1152     *
1153     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1154     * idempotent and deterministic.
1155     *

1157     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1158     *
1159     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1160     */
1161    @OverridingEncouraged

1163      return false;
1164    }
1165
1166    /**
1167     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1168     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadWildcardType} is
1169     * assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the
1170     * supplied {@code receiverClass}, according to the assignability
1171     * rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and
1172     * only if {@code payloadWildcardType} models a Java {@linkplain
1173     * java.lang.reflect.WildcardType wildcard type} and not any other
1174     * type, and if and only if {@code receiverClass} models a
1175     * {@linkplain Class Java class} and not any other type.
1176     *
1177     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1178     * method.</p>
1179     *
1180     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1181     *
1182     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1183     * receiverClass}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1184     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1185     *
1186     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadWildcardType};
1187     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1188     *
1189     * @param receiverClass the receiver type as described above; must
1190     * not be {@code null}
1191     *
1192     * @param payloadWildcardType the payload type as described above; must
1193     * not be {@code null}
1194     *
1195     * @param lowerBounded whether {@code payloadWildcardType} is a
1196     * lower-bounded wildcard type
1197     *
1198     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1199     *
1200     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1201     * idempotent and deterministic.
1202     *
1203     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1204     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1205     *
1206     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1207     */
1208    @OverridingEncouraged
1209    protected <X, Y> boolean classIsAssignableFromWildcardType(final Type<X> receiverClass, final Type<Y> payloadWildcardType, final boolean lowerBounded) {
1210      return false;
1211    }
1212
1213    private final <X, Y> boolean parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromType(final Type<X> receiverParameterizedType, final Type<Y> payloadType) {
1214      if (payloadType.hasTypeArguments()) {
1215        return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
1216      } else if (payloadType.componentType() == null) {
1217        if (payloadType.lowerBounded()) {
1218          return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType, true);
1219        } else if (payloadType.upperBounded()) {
1220          if (payloadType.named()) {
1221            return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
1222          } else {
1223            return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType, false);
1224          }
1225        } else {
1226          return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
1227        }
1228      } else if (payloadType.type() == payloadType) {
1229        return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
1230      } else {
1231        return this.parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverParameterizedType, payloadType);
1232      }
1233    }
1234
1235    /**
1236     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1237     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadClass} is assignable
1238     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code
1239     * receiverParameterizedType}, according to the assignability
1240     * rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and
1241     * only if {@code payloadClass} models a Java {@linkplain Class
1242     * class} and not any other type, and if and only if {@code
1243     * receiverParameterizedType} models a {@linkplain
1244     * java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType parameterized type} and not
1245     * any other type.
1246     *
1247     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1248     * method.</p>
1249     *
1250     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1251     *
1252     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1253     * receiverParameterizedType}; often a {@link
1254     * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1255     *
1256     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1257     * payloadClass}; often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type
1258     * java.lang.reflect.Type}
1259     *
1260     * @param receiverParameterizedType the receiver type as described
1261     * above; must not be {@code null}
1262     *
1263     * @param payloadClass the payload type as described above; must
1264     * not be {@code null}
1265     *
1266     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1267     *
1268     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1269     * idempotent and deterministic.
1270     *
1271     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1272     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1273     *
1274     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1275     */
1276    @OverridingEncouraged
1277    protected <X, Y> boolean parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromClass(final Type<X> receiverParameterizedType,
1278                                                                    final Type<Y> payloadClass) {
1279      return false;
1280    }
1281
1282    /**
1283     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the

1424    /**
1425     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1426     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadWildcardType} is
1427     * assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the
1428     * supplied {@code receiverParameterizedType}, according to the
1429     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance,
1430     * and if and only if {@code payloadWildcardType} models a Java
1431     * {@linkplain java.lang.reflect.WildcardType wildcard type} and
1432     * not any other type, and if and only if {@code
1433     * receiverParameterizedType} models a {@linkplain
1434     * java.lang.reflect.ParameterizedType parameterized type} and not
1435     * any other type.
1436     *
1437     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1438     * method.</p>
1439     *
1440     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1441     *
1442     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1443     * receiverParameterizedType}; often a {@link
1444     * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1445     *
1446     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadWildcardType};
1447     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1448     *
1449     * @param receiverParameterizedType the receiver type as described
1450     * above; must not be {@code null}
1451     *
1452     * @param payloadWildcardType the payload type as described above; must
1453     * not be {@code null}
1454     *
1455     * @param lowerBounded whether {@code payloadWildcardType} is a
1456     * lower-bounded wildcard type
1457     *
1458     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1459     *
1460     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1461     * idempotent and deterministic.
1462     *
1463     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1464     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1465     *
1466     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1467     */
1468    @OverridingEncouraged
1469    protected <X, Y> boolean parameterizedTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(final Type<X> receiverParameterizedType,
1470                                                                           final Type<Y> payloadWildcardType,
1471                                                                           final boolean lowerBounded) {
1472      return false;
1473    }
1474
1475    private final <X, Y> boolean genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverGenericArrayType,
1476                                                                                      final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1477      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
1478        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
1479          return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
1480        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
1481          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
1482            return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1483          } else {
1484            return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
1485          }
1486        } else {
1487          return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1488        }
1489      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1490        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1491      } else {
1492        return this.genericArrayTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverGenericArrayType, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1493      }
1494    }

1733    private final <X, Y> boolean typeVariableIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverTypeVariable,
1734                                                                                  final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1735      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
1736        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
1737          return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
1738        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
1739          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
1740            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1741          } else {
1742            return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
1743          }
1744        } else {
1745          return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromClass(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1746        }
1747      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1748        return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromClass(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1749      } else {
1750        return this.typeVariableIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverTypeVariable, payloadNonParameterizedType);
1751      }
1752    }

1843    protected <X, Y> boolean typeVariableIsAssignableFromParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverTypeVariable, final Type<Y> payloadParameterizedType) {
1844      return false;
1845    }

1941    /**
1942     * Returns {@code true} if and only if a reference bearing the
1943     * type modeled by the supplied {@code payloadWildcardType} is
1944     * assignable to a reference bearing the type modeled by the
1945     * supplied {@code receiverTypeVariable}, according to the
1946     * assignability rules modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance,
1947     * and if and only if {@code payloadWildcardType} models a Java
1948     * {@linkplain java.lang.reflect.WildcardType wildcard type} and
1949     * not any other type, and if and only if {@code
1950     * receiverTypeVariable} models a {@linkplain
1951     * java.lang.reflect.TypeVariable type variable} and not any other
1952     * type.
1953     *
1954     * <p>This method is called by the {@link #assignable(Type, Type)}
1955     * method.</p>
1956     *
1957     * <p>This implementation returns {@code false} in all cases.
1958     *
1959     * @param <X> the kind of type modeled by the {@code
1960     * receiverTypeVariable}; often a {@link
1961     * java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1962     *
1963     * @param <Y> the kind of type modeled by the {@code payloadWildcardType};
1964     * often a {@link java.lang.reflect.Type java.lang.reflect.Type}
1965     *
1966     * @param receiverTypeVariable the receiver type as described
1967     * above; must not be {@code null}
1968     *
1969     * @param payloadWildcardType the payload type as described above; must
1970     * not be {@code null}
1971     *
1972     * @param lowerBounded whether {@code payloadWildcardType} is a
1973     * lower-bounded wildcard type
1974     *
1975     * @return {@code false} in all cases
1976     *
1977     * @idempotency This method is, and its overrides must be,
1978     * idempotent and deterministic.
1979     *
1980     * @threadsafety This method is, and its overrides must be, safe
1981     * for concurrent use by multiple threads.
1982     *
1983     * @see #assignable(Type, Type)
1984     */
1985    @OverridingEncouraged
1986    protected <X, Y> boolean typeVariableIsAssignableFromWildcardType(final Type<X> receiverTypeVariable,
1987                                                                      final Type<Y> payloadWildcardType,
1988                                                                      final boolean lowerBounded) {
1989      return false;
1990    }
1991
1992    private final <X, Y> boolean wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromNonParameterizedType(final Type<X> receiverWildcardType,
1993                                                                           final boolean lowerBounded,
1994                                                                           final Type<Y> payloadNonParameterizedType) {
1995      if (payloadNonParameterizedType.componentType() == null) {
1996        if (payloadNonParameterizedType.lowerBounded()) {
1997          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType, true);
1998        } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.upperBounded()) {
1999          if (payloadNonParameterizedType.named()) {
2000            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromTypeVariable(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2001          } else {
2002            return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromWildcardType(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType, false);
2003          }
2004        } else {
2005          return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2006        }
2007      } else if (payloadNonParameterizedType.type() == payloadNonParameterizedType) {
2008        return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromClass(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2009      } else {
2010        return this.wildcardTypeIsAssignableFromGenericArrayType(receiverWildcardType, lowerBounded, payloadNonParameterizedType);
2011      }
2012    }
2013

2017     * to a reference bearing the type modeled by the supplied {@code

2019     * modeled by this {@link Semantics} instance, and if and only if
2020     * {@code payloadClass} models a Java {@linkplain Class class} and
2021     * not any other type, and if and only if {@code
2022     * receiverWildcardType} models a {@linkplain
2023     * java.lang.reflect.WildcardType wildcard type} and not any other
2024     * type.
